2 обзор на игру, которую я хочу сделать, это Left 4 Dead. Обзор будет коротким. Я эту игру проходил в 2016 году и все что я помню это то, что ее делала Вальв это раз, а во вторых в самой игре были какие то зомби и главная задача была выжить. Если меня раньше радовали такие игры, где надо выжить и сражаться против нежити, то пускай это будет какие нибудь 3 герои, или все те же Кингс баунти. Но вот только не такие игры, где 4 человека, с каждым своим навыком будет сражаться против орды зомби. Вот если бы была бы прокачка персонажа там, или баффы какие нибудь, я бы в нее зашел снова, хоть прямо сейчас а так . Моя оценка 7 из 10 мертвых зомби. насчет музыки я непомню, багов небыло.

[h1] Left 4 Dead [/h1]

[b] The Zombie Title That Defined A Generation [/b]

Instantly reviving the coop shooter, [b] Left 4 Dead [/b] was yet another groundbreaking achievement for Valve. Released during an age where cooperative gameplay was becoming a relic of the past, this action-packed zombie extravaganza almost single handedly revived public interest and developer support for coop experiences. With tight gunplay and great sound design, lots of replayability due to a unique due to the creation of "The Director", and well designed maps which were able to be enjoyed in a multitude of modes, Left 4 Dead provided a framework for one of the best coop games ever created. 

The gunplay and sound design of this game is amazing. The guns all feel like they pack a punch, and the different hordes and special zombies provide great atmosphere and sound ques to let the player know what terror is arriving next. Certain melodies may indicate that a Hunter is prowling around the area, whereas other may alert the player that a Smoker is ready to grapple a teammate to their deaths. All of this culminates in adding to the atmosphere of the game, creating a nice horror theme in the world.

"The Director" is where the game shines apart from other shooters of its time, and even many others from today's slew of coop experiences. This system allowed the AI to place swarms of enemies at any given location that was out of sight for the players, and placed special zombies in locations that could do some damage or even kill players. It avoids feeling cheap by giving enough space for enemy spawns (for the most part), and diversifying the limited number of special zombies by spawning them in many different scenarios. This led to the game flowing nicely and creating a system that encourages teamwork, cooperation, and sticking together.

Lastly, I'll focus on the map design. There are six available campaigns, each with 2-5 acts within their runtime. From grimy city streets and sewers, to run down farms and factories, it almost feels like there isn't a classic zombie scenario you "don't" find yourself experiencing. My personal favorite was "Dead Air", which takes place within a destroyed airport. Additionally, with the campaign, versus, and survival modes, you can play through every map with friends, against enemy players taking control of zombies, or survive as long as possible against hordes of zombies. While the servers for this title are unpopulated at times, it is still a blast to play through solo or with friends.

To conclude, [b] Left 4 Dead [/b] is an important title in gaming history. It brought back mainstream appeal in cooperative experiences, with many titles in the late 2000's shifting to PvP multiplayer modes. This title provided a breath of fresh air within an industry that continued to settle for a lack of innovation in cooperation. While it only says I have played 6 hours at the time of this review, I have spent over 100 hours on the Xbox 360 during its original release. I [b] Recommend [/b] anyone to pick up this title!

[h2] Final Verdict: 8/10 (Great) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!
